event.name: MC Reqs
event.description: Counts the number of requests to the memory controller.

event.title: CCN-504
event.name: QOS HH Retry
event.description: Counts the number of times a highest-priority QoS class was retried at the HN-F.

event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Includes the speculative linefills in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. Includes the speculative requests in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. Counts the number of allocations performed in the Data Cache because of a read or a write.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. This includes speculative reads.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. This does not include micro TLB misses because of PLD, PLI, CP15 Cache operation by MVA and CP15 VA to PA operations.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. Counts the number of exceptions architecturally taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Change to ContextID retired. Counts the number of instructions architecturally executed writing into the ContextID register.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted. Counts the number of mispredicted or not-predicted branches executed. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data write
event.description: Level 2 data cache write-back. Data transfers made as a result of a coherency request from the Level 2 caches to outside of the Level 1 and Level 2 caches are not counted. Write-backs made as a result of CP15 cache maintenance operations are counted.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: Bus accesses. Single transfer bus accesses on either of the ACE read or write channels might increment twice in one cycle if both the read and write channels are active simultaneously.Operations that utilise the bus that do not explicitly transfer data, such as barrier or coherency operations are counted as bus accesses.

event.title: Stall
event.name: DPU IP empty
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle that the DPU IQ is empty and that is not because of a recent micro-TLB miss, instruction cache miss or pre-decode error.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Cache miss
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle the DPU IQ is empty and there is an instruction cache miss being processed.

event.title: Stall
event.name: TLB miss
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle the DPU IQ is empty and there is an instruction micro-TLB miss being processed.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Pre-decode error
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle the DPU IQ is empty and there is a pre-decode error being processed.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Interlock other
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is not because of an Advanced SIMD or Floating-point instruction, and not because of a load/store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address in the AGU. Stall cycles because of a stall in Wr, typically awaiting load data, are excluded.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Interlock address
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is because of a load/store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address in the AGU. Stall cycles because of a stall in Wr, typically awaiting load data, are excluded.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Interlock SIMD/FPU
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is an interlock that is because of an Advanced SIMD or Floating-point instruction. Stall cycles because of a stall in the Wr stage, typically awaiting load data, are excluded.

event.title: Stall
event.name: Load miss
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is a stall in the Wr stage because of a load miss

event.title: Stall
event.name: Store
event.description: Attributable Performance Impact Event. Counts every cycle there is a stall in the Wr stage because of a store.

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Software increment. The register is incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Includes the speculative linefills in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. Includes the speculative requests in the count.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. Counts the number of allocations performed in the Data Cache because of a read or a write.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at (at least) the lowest level of data or unified cache. This includes speculative reads.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at (at least) the lowest level of TLB. This does not include micro TLB misses because of PLD, PLI, CP15 Cache operation by MVA and CP15 VA to PA operations.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory read
event.description: Data read architecturally executed. Counts the number of data read instructions accepted by the Load Store Unit. This includes counting the speculative and aborted LDR/LDM, and the reads because of the SWP instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Data write architecturally executed. Counts the number of data write instructions accepted by the Load Store Unit. This includes counting the speculative and aborted STR/STM, and the writes because of the SWP instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. Counts the number of exceptions architecturally taken.

event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Change to ContextID retired. Counts the number of instructions architecturally executed writing into the ContextID Register.

event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of PC

event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed (taken or not taken). This includes the branches which are flushed due to a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Procedure

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted/not predicted. Counts the number of mispredicted or not-predicted branches executed. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed (taken or not taken). This includes the branches which are flushed due to a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Procedure return (other than exception returns) architecturally executed

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned load-store

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted/not predicted. Counts the number of mispredicted or not-predicted branches executed. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor. This includes the branches which are flushed because of a previous load/store which aborts late.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Memory access
event.description: Data memory access

event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: Instruction Cache access

event.name: L1 data eviction
event.description: Data cache eviction

event.description: Level 2 data cache access

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data refill
event.description: Level 2 data cache refill

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 data write
event.description: Level 2 data cache write-back. Data transfers made as a result of a coherency request from the Level 2 caches to outside of the Level 1 and Level 2 caches are not counted. Write-backs made as a result of CP15 cache maintenance operations are counted.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: Bus accesses. Single transfer bus accesses on either of the ACE read or write channels might increment twice in one cycle if both the read and write channels are active simultaneously. Operations that utilise the bus that do not explicitly transfer data, such as barrier or coherency operations are counted as bus accesses.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Cycle
event.description: Bus cycle

event.title: Bus
event.name: Read
event.description: Bus access, read

event.title: Bus
event.name: Write
event.description: Bus access, write

event.name: IRQ
event.description: IRQ exception taken

event.name: FIQ
event.description: FIQ exception taken

event.name: External request
event.description: External memory request

event.title: Memory
event.name: Non-cacheable ext req
event.description: Non-cacheable external memory request

event.title: Cache
event.name: Linefill
event.description: Linefill because of prefetch

event.title: Cache
event.name: Linefill dropped
event.description: Prefetch linefill dropped

event.title: Cache
event.name: Allocate mode enter
event.description: Entering read allocate mode

event.title: Cache
event.name: Allocate mode
event.description: Read allocate mode

event.title: ETM
event.name: ETM Ext Out[0]
event.description: ETM Ext Out[0]

event.title: ETM
event.name: ETM Ext Out[1]
event.description: ETM Ext Out[1]

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Pipeline stall
event.description: Data Write operation that stalls the pipeline because the store buffer is full

event.title: Memory
event.name: Snoop
event.description: Data snooped from other processor. This event counts memory-read operations that read data from another processor within the local Cortex-A7 cluster, rather than accessing the L2 cache or issuing an external read. It increments on each transaction, rather than on each beat of data.

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at the lowest level of instruction or unified cache. Each instruction fetch from normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from outside of the cache is counted. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted. Where instruction fetches consist of multiple instructions, these accesses count as single events. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative instruction fetches and for fetches of instructions that reach execution.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at the lowest level of TLB. Each instruction fetch that causes a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching is counted. CP15 TLB maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative instruction fetches and for fetches of instructions that reach execution.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at the lowest level of data or unified cache. Each data read from or write to normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from outside of the cache is counted. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted. Each access to a cache line to normal cacheable memory that causes a new linefill is counted, including the multiple transaction of instructions such as LDM or STM, PUSH and POP. Write-through writes that hit in the cache do not cause a linefill and so are not counted. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at the lowest level of data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line to normal cacheable memory is counted including the multiple transaction of instructions such as LDM or STM. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at the lowest level of TLB. Each data read or write operation that causes a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching is counted. CP15 TLB maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory read
event.description: Data read architecturally executed. This counter increments for every instruction that explicitly read data, including SWP. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Data write architecturally executed. The counter increments for every instruction that explicitly wrote data, including SWP. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed. This counter counts for all instructions, including conditional instructions that fail their condition codes.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken. This counts for each exception taken.

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Instruction that writes to the Context ID Register architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of PC, except by an exception, architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed, taken or not taken. This includes B{L}, BLX, CB{N}Z, HB{L}, and HBLP. This counter counts for all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed, including conditional instructions that fail their condition codes.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Procedure return, other than exception returns, architecturally executed. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned access architecturally executed. This counts each instruction that is an access to an unaligned address. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted. This counts for every pipeline flush because of a misprediction from the program flow prediction resources.

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branches or other change in the program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Write buffer full
event.description: Any write buffer full cycle

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 store
event.description: Any store that is merged in the L2 memory system

event.title: Cache
event.name: Bufferable transaction
event.description: Any bufferable store transaction from load/store to L2 cache, excluding eviction or cast out data

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 access
event.description: Any accesses to the L2 cache

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 miss
event.description: Any cacheable miss in the L2 cache

event.title: AXI
event.name: Read
event.description: The number of AXI read data transfers

event.title: AXI
event.name: Write
event.description: The number of AXI write data transfers

event.title: Memory
event.name: Replay event
event.description: Any replay event in the memory system

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access replay
event.description: Any unaligned memory access that results in a replay

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 data hash miss
event.description: Any L1 data memory access that misses in the cache as a result of the hashing algorithm. The cases covered are: hash hit and physical address miss, hash hit and physical address hit in another way and hash miss and physical address hit.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst hash miss
event.description: Any L1 instruction memory access that misses in the cache as a result of the hashing algorithm. The cases covered are: hash hit and physical address miss, hash hit and physical address hit in another way and hash miss and physical address hit.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 page coloring
event.description: Any L1 data memory access in which a page coloring alias occurs. alias = virtual address [12] ! = physical address [12]. This behavior results in a data memory eviction or cast out.

event.title: NEON
event.name: L1 cache hit
event.description: Any NEON access that hits in the L1 data cache

event.title: NEON
event.name: L1 cache access
event.description: Any NEON cacheable data accesses for L1 data cache

event.title: NEON
event.name: L2 cache access
event.description: Any L2 cache accesses as a result of a NEON memory access

event.title: NEON
event.name: L2 cache hit
event.description: Any NEON hit in the L2 cache

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: Any L1 instruction cache access, excluding CP15 cache accesses

event.title: Branch
event.name: Return stack misprediction
event.description: Any return stack misprediction because of incorrect target address for a taken return stack pop

event.title: Branch
event.name: Direction misprediction
event.description: Two forms of branch direction misprediction: branch predicted taken, but was not taken and branch predicted not taken, but was taken

event.title: Branch
event.name: Taken prediction
event.description: Any predictable branch that is predicted to be taken

event.title: Branch
event.name: Executed and taken prediction
event.description: Any predictable branch that is executed and taken

event.title: Core
event.name: Operations issued
event.description: Number of operations issued, where an operation is either: an instruction or one operation in a sequence of operations that make up a multi-cycle instruction

event.title: Core
event.name: No issue cycles
event.description: Increment for every cycle that no instructions are available for issue

event.title: Core
event.name: Issue cycles
event.description: For every cycle, this event counts the number of instructions issued in that cycle. Multi-cycle instructions are only counted once.

event.title: NEON
event.name: MRC data wait
event.description: Number of cycles the processor stalls waiting on MRC data from NEON

event.title: NEON
event.name: Full queue
event.description: Number of cycles that the processor stalls as a result of a full NEON instruction queue or NEON load queue

event.title: NEON
event.name: Idle
event.description: Number of cycles that NEON and integer processors are both not idle

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[0]
event.description: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[0]

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[1]
event.description: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[1]

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[0,1]
event.description: Counts any event from both external input sources PMUEXTIN[0] and PMUEXTIN[1]

event.title: Clock
event.name: Cycles
event.description: The number of core clock cycles

event.title: Software
event.name: Increment
event.description: Incremented only on writes to the Software Increment Register

event.title: Cache
event.name: Instruction refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a refill of at least the level of instruction or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst TLB refill
event.description: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill of at least the level of TLB closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data refill
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a refill of at least the level of data or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data access
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a cache access to at least the level of data or unified cache closest to the processor

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data TLB refill
event.description: Memory Read or Write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the level of TLB closest to the processor

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory read
event.description: Memory-reading instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Memory-writing instruction architecturally executed

event.title: Exception
event.name: Taken
event.description: Exception taken

event.title: Exception
event.name: Return
event.description: Exception return architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: CONTEXTIDR
event.description: Instruction that writes to the CONTEXTIDR architecturally executed

event.title: Branch
event.name: PC change
event.description: Software change of the Program Counter, except by an exception, architecturally executed

event.title: Branch
event.name: Immediate
event.description: Immediate branch architecturally executed

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access
event.description: Unaligned access architecturally executed

event.title: Branch
event.name: Mispredicted
event.description: Branch mispredicted or not predicted

event.title: Branch
event.name: Potential prediction
event.description: Branch or other change in program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor

event.title: Java
event.name: Bytecode execute
event.description: Counts the number of Java bytecodes being decoded, including speculative ones

event.title: Java
event.name: SW bytecode execute
event.description: Counts the number of software Java bytecodes being decoded, including speculative ones

event.title: Jazelle
event.name: Backward branch execute
event.description: Counts the number of Jazelle taken branches being executed. This includes the branches that are flushed because of a previous load/store that aborts late.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Coherency miss
event.description: Counts the number of coherent linefill requests performed by the Cortex-A9 processor that also miss in all the other Cortex-A9 processors. This means that the request is sent to the external memory.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Coherency hit
event.description: Counts the number of coherent linefill requests performed by the Cortex-A9 processor that hit in another Cortex-A9 processor. This means that the linefill data is fetched directly from the relevant Cortex-A9 cache.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Inst dependent stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor: is ready to accept new instructions, does not receive a new instruction, because: the instruction side is unable to provide one or the instruction cache is performing at least one linefill

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data dependent stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor has some instructions that it cannot issue to any pipeline, and the Load Store unit has at least one pending linefill request, and no pending TLB requests

event.title: Cache
event.name: TLB stall
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor is stalled waiting for the completion of translation table walks from the main TLB. The processor stalls because the instruction side is not able to provide the instructions, or the data side is not able to provide the necessary data.

event.title: Intrinsic
event.name: STREX pass
event.description: Counts the number of STREX instructions architecturally executed and passed

event.title: Intrinsic
event.name: STREX fail
event.description: Counts the number of STREX instructions architecturally executed and failed

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data eviction
event.description: Counts the number of eviction requests because of a linefill in the data cache

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Issue stage no dispatch
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the issue stage does not dispatch any instruction because it is empty or cannot dispatch any instructions

event.title: Pipeline
event.name: Issue stage empty
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the issue stage is empty

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Executed
event.description: Counts the number of instructions going through the Register Renaming stage. This number is an approximate number of the total number of instructions speculatively executed, and an even more approximate number of the total number of instructions architecturally executed. The approximation depends mainly on the branch misprediction rate.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Data linefills
event.description: Counts the number of linefills performed on the external AXI bus. This event counts all data linefill requests, caused by: loads, including speculative ones, stores, PLD, prefetch or page table walk.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Prefetch linefills
event.description: Counts the number of data linefills caused by prefetcher requests

event.title: Cache
event.name: Prefetch hits
event.description: Counts the number of cache hits in a line that belongs to a stream followed by the prefetcher. This includes: lines that have been prefetched by the automatic data prefetcher and lines already present in the cache, before the prefetcher action.

event.title: Procedure
event.name: Return
event.description: Counts the number of procedure returns whose condition codes do not fail, excluding all returns from exception. This count includes procedure returns that are flushed because of a previous load/store that aborts late.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Main execution unit
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the main execution pipeline of the processor, the multiply pipeline and arithmetic logic unit pipeline. The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Second execution unit
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the processor second execution pipeline (ALU). The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: Counts the number of instructions being executed in the Load/Store unit. The counted instructions are still speculative.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: Floating point
event.description: Counts the number of floating-point instructions going through the Register Rename stage. Instructions are still speculative in this stage.

event.title: Instruction
event.name: NEON
event.description: Counts the number of NEON instructions going through the Register Rename stage. Instructions are still speculative in this stage.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: PLD
event.description: Counts the number of cycles where the processor is stalled because PLD slots are all full

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Memory write
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the processor is stalled. The data side is stalled also, because it is full and executes writes to the external memory.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Inst main TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of main TLB misses on requests issued by the instruction side

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Data main TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of main TLB misses on requests issued by the data side

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Inst micro TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of micro TLB misses on the instruction side. This event does not include main TLB miss stall cycles that are already counted in the corresponding main TLB event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Data micro TLB miss
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of micro TLB misses on the data side. This event does not include main TLB miss stall cycles that are already counted in the corresponding main TLB event.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: DMB
event.description: Counts the number of stall cycles because of the execution of a DMB. This includes all DMB instructions being executed, even speculatively.

event.title: Clock
event.name: Integer core
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the integer core clock is enabled

event.title: Clock
event.name: Data engine
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the data engine clock is enabled

event.title: Clock
event.name: NEON
event.description: Counts the number of cycles when the NEON SIMD clock is enabled

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB inst allocations
event.description: Counts the number of TLB allocations because of Instruction requests

event.title: Memory
event.name: TLB data allocations
event.description: Counts the number of TLB allocations because of Data requests

event.title: Instruction
event.name: ISB
event.description: Counts the number of ISB instructions architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DSB
event.description: Counts the number of DSB instructions architecturally executed

event.title: Instruction
event.name: DMB
event.description: Counts the number of DMB instructions speculatively executed

event.title: External
event.name: Interrupts
event.description: Counts the number of external interrupts executed by the processor

event.title: PLE
event.name: Cache line rq completed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE cache line requests completed

event.title: PLE
event.name: Cache line rq skipped
event.description: Counts the number of PLE cache line requests skipped

event.title: PLE
event.name: FIFO flush
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush requests

event.title: PLE
event.name: Request completed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush completed

event.title: PLE
event.name: FIFO overflow
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush overflowed

event.title: PLE
event.name: Request programmed
event.description: Counts the number of PLE FIFO flush program requests

event.title: Kmem
event.name: kmalloc
event.description: Number of bytes allocated in the kernel using kmalloc

event.title: Ext4
event.name: ext4_da_write
event.description: Number of bytes written to an ext4 filesystem

event.title: F2FS
event.name: f2fs_write
event.description: Number of bytes written to an f2fs filesystem

event.title: Power
event.name: clock_set_rate
event.description: Clock rate state

event.title: Block

event.description: Number of block IO operations completed by device driver

event.title: Block

event.description: Number of block IO operations issued to device driver

event.description: Number of times cpu_idle is entered or exited

event.description: Phy. used ZRAM size

event.title: Clock
event.name: Frequency
event.description: Frequency setting of the CPU

event.title: CPU Contention
event.name: Wait
event.description: One or more threads are runnable but waiting due to CPU contention

event.title: CPU I/O
event.name: Wait
event.description: One or more threads are blocked on an I/O resource

event.title: CPU Status
event.name: Activity
event.description: CPU Status

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the MaliGP2 was active.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, vertex shader
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the vertex shader unit was active.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, vertex storer
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the vertex storer unit was active.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, vertex loader
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the vertex loader unit was active.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Cycles vertex loader waiting for vertex shader
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the vertex loader was idle while waiting on the vertex shader.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Words read, system bus
event.description: Total number of 64 bit words read by the GP2 from the system bus per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Words written, system bus
event.description: Total number of 64 bit words written by the GP2 to the system bus per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Read bursts, system bus
event.description: Number of read bursts by the GP2 from the system bus per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Write bursts, system bus
event.description: Number of write bursts from the MaliGP2 to the system bus per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Vertices processed
event.description: Number of vertices processed by the MaliGP2 per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Vertices fetched
event.description: Number of vertices fetched by the MaliGP2 per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Primitives fetched
event.description: Number of graphics primitives fetched by the MaliGP2 per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Primitives culled
event.description: Number of graphics primitives discarded per frame, because they were seen from the back or were offscreen.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Commands written to tiles
event.description: Number of commands (8 Bytes, mainly primitives) written by GP2 to the PP input data structure per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Memory blocks allocated
event.description: Number of overflow data blocks needed for outputting the PP input data structure per frame .

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Vertex loader cache misses
event.description: Number of cache misses for the vertex shader's vertex input unit per frame.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, vertex shader command processor
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the GP2 vertex shader command processor was active. This includes time waiting for semaphores.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, PLBU command processor
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the MaliGP2 PLBU command processor was active. This includes time waiting for semaphores.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active Cycles, PLBU list writer
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the MaliGP2 PLBU output unit was active. This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, PLBU geometry processing
event.description: Number of cycles per frame the MaliGP2 PLBU was active, excepting final data output. In other words: active cycles through the prepare list commands. This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, PLBU primitive assembly
event.description: Number of active cycles per frame spent by the MaliGP2 PLBU doing primitive assembly. This does not include scissoring or final output. This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, PLBU vertex fetcher
event.description: Number of active cycles per frame spent by the MaliGP2 PLBU fetching vertex data. This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, Bounding-box and command generator
event.description: Number of active cycles per frame spent by the MaliGP2 PLBU setting up bounding boxes and commands (mainly graphics primitives). This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, Scissor tile iterator
event.description: Number of active cycles per frame spent by the MaliGP2 PLBU iterating over tiles to perform scissoring. This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx VP
event.name: Active cycles, PLBU tile iterator
event.description: Number of active cycles per frame spent by the MaliGP2 PLBU iterating over the tiles in the bounding box generating commands (mainly graphics primitives). This includes time spent waiting on the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Active clock cycles
event.description: Active clock cycles, between polygon start and IRQ.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Total bus reads
event.description: Total number of 64-bit words read from the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Total bus writes
event.description: Total number of 64-bit words written to the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Bus read request cycles
event.description: Number of cycles during which the bus read request signal was HIGH.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Bus write request cycles
event.description: Number of cycles during which the bus write request signal was HIGH.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Bus read transactions count
event.description: Number of read requests accepted by the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Bus write transactions
event.description: Number of write requests accepted by the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Tile writeback writes
event.description: 64-bit words written to the bus by the writeback unit.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Store unit writes
event.description: 64-bit words written to the bus by the store unit.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture cache uncompressed reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus into the uncompressed textures cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Polygon list reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus by the polygon list reader.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: RSW reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus into the Render State Word register.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Vertex cache reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus into the vertex cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Uniform remapping reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus when reading from the uniform remapping table.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Program cache reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus into the fragment shader program cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Varying reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words containing varyings generated by the vertex processing read from the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture descriptors reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words containing texture descriptors read from the bus.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture descriptor remapping reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus when reading from the texture descriptor remapping table.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Load unit reads
event.description: Number of 64-bit words read from the bus by the LOAD sub-instruction.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Polygon count
event.description: Number of triangles read from the polygon list.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Pixel rectangle count
event.description: Number of pixel rectangles read from the polygon list.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Lines count
event.description: Number of lines read from the polygon list.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Points count
event.description: Number of points read from the polygon list.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Stall cycles PolygonListReader
event.description: Number of clock cycles the Polygon List Reader waited for output being collected.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Stall cycles triangle setup
event.description: Number of clock cycles the TSC waited for input.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Quad rasterized count
event.description: Number of 2x?2 quads output from rasterizer.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Fragment rasterized count
event.description: Number of fragment rasterized. Fragments/(Quads*4) gives average actual fragments per quad.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Fragment rejected fragment-kill count
event.description: Number of fragments exiting the fragment shader as killed.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Fragment rejected fwd-fragment-kill count
event.description: Number of fragments killed by forward fragment kill.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Fragment passed z/stencil count
event.description: Number of fragments passing Z and stencil test.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Patches rejected early z/stencil count
event.description: Number of patches rejected by EarlyZ. A patch can be 8x8, 4x4 or 2x2 pixels.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Patches evaluated
event.description: Number of patches evaluated for EarlyZ rejection.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction completed count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instruction words completed. It is a function of pixels processed and the length of the shader programs.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction failed rendezvous count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instructions not completed because of failed Rendezvous.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction failed varying-miss count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instructions not completed because of failed varying operation.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction failed texture-miss count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instructions not completed because of failed texture operation.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction failed load-miss count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instructions not completed because of failed load operation.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction failed tile read-miss count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instructions not completed because of failed read from the tilebuffer.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Instruction failed store-miss count
event.description: Number of fragment shader instructions not completed because of failed store operation.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Rendezvous breakage count
event.description: Number of Rendezvous breakages reported.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Pipeline bubbles cycle count
event.description: Number of unused cycles in the fragment shader while rendering is active.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture mapper multipass count
event.description: Number of texture operations looped because of more texture passes needed.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture mapper cycle count
event.description: Number of texture operation cycles.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Vertex cache hit count
event.description: Number of times a requested vertex was found in the cache (Number of vertex cache hits).

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Vertex cache miss count
event.description: Number of times a requested vertex was not found in the cache (Number of vertex cache misses).

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Varying cache hit count
event.description: Number of times a requested varying was found in the cache (Number of varying cache hits).

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Varying cache miss count
event.description: Number of times a requested varying was not found in the cache (Number of varying cache misses).

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Varying cache conflict miss count
event.description: Number of times a requested varying was not in the cache and its value, retrieved from memory, must overwrite an older cache entry. This happens when an access pattern cannot be serviced by the cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture cache hit count
event.description: Number of times a requested texel was found in the texture cache (Number of texture cache hits).

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture cache miss count
event.description: Number of times a requested texel was not found in the texture cache (Number of texture cache misses).

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Texture cache conflict miss count
event.description: Number of times a requested texel was not in the cache and its value, retrieved from memory, must overwrite an older cache entry. This happens when an access pattern cannot be serviced by the cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Compressed texture cache hit count
event.description: Number of times a requested item was found in the cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Compressed texture cache miss count
event.description: Number of times a requested item was not found in the cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Load/Store cache hit count
event.description: Number of hits in the load/store cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Load/Store cache miss count
event.description: Number of misses in the load/store cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Program cache hit count
event.description: Number of hits in the program cache.

event.title: Mali-4xx FP
event.name: Program cache miss count
event.description: Number of misses in the program cache.
